params.doc: The ID of the environment to update.  If no environment with this ID exists, Amazon ElasticBeanstalk returns an InvalidParameterValue error.
params.name: EnvironmentId
EnvironmentName
params.doc: The name of the environment to update. If no environment with this name exists, Amazon ElasticBeanstalk returns an InvalidParameterValue error.

params.name: VersionLabel
params.doc: If this parameter is specified, Amazon ElasticBeanstalk deploys the named application version to the environment. If no such application version is found, returns an InvalidParameterValue error.

params.name: TemplateName
params.doc: If this parameter is specified, Amazon ElasticBeanstalk deploys this configuration template to the environment. If no such configuration template is found, Amazon ElasticBeanstalk returns an InvalidParameterValue error.

params.name: Description
params.doc: If this parameter is specified, Amazon ElasticBeanstalk updates the description of this environment.

params.name: OptionSettings
params.doc: If specified, Amazon ElasticBeanstalk updates the configuration set associated with the running environment and sets the specified configuration options to the requested value.

items.doc: A specification identifying an individual configuration option along with its current value.

properties.name: Namespace
properties.doc: A unique namespace identifying the option's associated AWS resource.

properties.name: OptionName
properties.doc: The name of the configuration option.

properties.name: Value
properties.doc: The current value for the configuration option.

params.name: OptionsToRemove
params.doc: A list of custom user-defined configuration options to remove from the configuration set for this environment.

items.doc: A specification identifying an individual configuration option.

properties.name: Namespace
properties.doc: A unique namespace identifying the option's associated AWS resource.

properties.name: OptionName
properties.doc: The name of the configuration option.
Describes the properties of an environment.
properties.name: UpdateEnvironmentResult
ApplicationName
properties.doc: The name of the application associated with this environment.

properties.name: VersionLabel
properties.doc: The application version deployed in this environment.

properties.name: SolutionStackName
properties.doc: The name of the SolutionStack deployed with this environment.

properties.name: TemplateName
properties.doc: The name of the configuration template used to originally launch this environment.
The URL to the load balancer for this environment.
properties.name: EndpointURL
CNAME
properties.doc: The URL to the CNAME for this environment.
The creation date for this environment.
properties.name: DateCreated

properties.doc: The last modified date for this environment.
properties.name: DateUpdated

properties.doc: The current operational status of the environment:     Launching : Environment is in the process of initial deployment.   Updating : Environment is in the process of updating its configuration settings or application version.   Ready : Environment is available to have an action performed on it, such as update or terminate.   Terminating : Environment is in the shut-down process.   Terminated : Environment is not running.
properties.name: Status

properties.doc: Describes the health status of the environment. Amazon ElasticBeanstalk indicates the failure levels for a running environment:     Red : Indicates the environment is not working.     Yellow : Indicates that something is wrong, the application might not be available, but the instances appear running.     Green : Indicates the environment is healthy and fully functional.       Red : Indicates the environment is not responsive. Occurs when three or more consecutive failures occur for an environment.   Yellow : Indicates that something is wrong. Occurs when two consecutive failures occur for an environment.   Green : Indicates the environment is healthy and fully functional.    Grey : Default health for a new environment. The environment is not fully launched and health checks have not started or health checks are suspended during an UpdateEnvironment or RestartEnvironement request.    Default: Grey .
properties.name: Health
